name: Analyser et r√©sumer les avis Google avec SerpAPI, GPT-4 et Google Sheets
description:
## Essayez-le !
Ce mod√®le n8n vous aide √† analyser les avis de Google Maps pour une liste de restaurants, √† les r√©sumer avec l'IA et √† identifier des opportunit√©s d'optimisation - le tout dans un flux de travail automatis√©.
Que vous g√©riez plusieurs emplacements, aidiez des restaurants locaux √† am√©liorer leur pr√©sence num√©rique ou r√©alisiez une analyse concurrentielle, ce flux de travail vous aide √† extraire des informations de dizaines d'avis en quelques minutes.

  Comment √ßa fonctionne ?
- Commencez avec une liste pr√©-remplie de restaurants dans Google Sheets.
- Le flux de travail utilise SerpAPI pour extraire les avis de Google Maps pour chaque annonce.
- Les avis avec contenu sont transmis √† ChatGPT pour r√©sum√©.
- Les avis vides ou √©chou√©s sont enregistr√©s dans un onglet s√©par√© pour un suivi facile.
- Les r√©sultats sont stock√©s dans votre Google Sheet pour analyse ou partage.

Comment utiliser
- Personnalisez la liste d'entr√©e dans Google Sheets avec vos propres restaurants.
- Mettez √† jour l'invite OpenAI si vous souhaitez un style de r√©sum√© diff√©rent.
- Vous pouvez d√©clencher cela manuellement ou remplacer par un calendrier, un webhook ou un autre √©v√©nement.

Exigences
- Un compte SerpAPI pour r√©cup√©rer les avis
- Un compte OpenAI pour le r√©sum√© ChatGPT
- Acc√®s √† Google Sheets et n8n

Pour qui est-ce ? 
- Cela est utile pour les personnes cherchant √† analyser un grand nombre d'avis Google en peu de temps. De plus, cela peut √™tre utilis√© pour comparer des restaurants et voir o√π chacun peut √™tre optimis√©.


Comment configurer ? 
- Utilisez un point de terminaison SerpAPI √† inclure dans le n≈ìud de requ√™te HTTP. Consultez cette documentation n8n pour plus d'aide ! https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolserpapi/. 

Bonne automatisation !

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

defaults.name: Lorsque vous cliquez sur ‚ÄòEx√©cuter le flux de travail‚Äô

nodes.name: If review text is NOT empty

parameters.content:
## Try It Out!
This n8n template helps you analyze Google Maps reviews for a list of restaurants, summarize them with AI, and identify optimization opportunities‚Äîall in one automated workflow.
Whether you're managing multiple locations, helping local restaurants improve their digital presence, or conducting a competitor analysis, this workflow helps you extract insights from dozens of reviews in minutes.

  How It Works?
- Start with a pre-filled list of restaurants in Google Sheets.
- The workflow uses SerpAPI to scrape Google Maps reviews for each listing.
- Reviews with content are passed to ChatGPT for summarization.
- Empty or failed reviews are logged in a separate tab for easy follow-up.
- Results are stored back in your Google Sheet for analysis or sharing

How To Use
- Customize the input list in Google Sheets with your own restaurants.
- Update the OpenAI prompt if you want a different style of summary.
- You can trigger this manually or swap in a schedule, webhook, or other event.

Requirements
- A SerpAPI account to fetch reviews
- An OpenAI account for ChatGPT summarization
- Access to Google Sheets and n8n

Who Is It For? 
- This is helpful for people looking to analyze a large batch of Google reviews in a short amount of time. Additionally, it can be used to compare restaurants and see where each can be optimized. 


How To Set-Up? 
- Use a SerpAPI endpoint to include in the HTTP request node. Refer to this n8n documentation for more help! https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolserpapi/. 

Happy Automating!

## 1. Scrape Google Maps Business Listings

Using the Google Sheets information gathered beforehand, the restaurant information (e.g. name, Google Maps URL) is passed into SerpAPI one by one.

## 2. Clean the Data and Identify Gaps 

The data from SerpAPI is structured messily and hard to understand. So, we use a code node to clean up un-necessary information. Afterwards, we can more easily identify gaps in the review. For example, if there is no review text we cannot analyze the review sentiment or extract keywords. 

For that reason, the if node is set to if reviewText = not empty (TRUE), it goes onto analysis by GPT-4. But, if reviewText = not empty (FALSE), it goes into a separate sheet called 'failed reviews'.

## 3. Analysis and Export

The GPT-4 summarizes the review, analyzes the sentiment, and extracts keywords from each. All of this information is exported into a Google Sheets.

## Step 1 -> Sample Input

Here‚Äôs what the Google Sheets input looks like:

![Review Summary](https://i.imgur.com/nzu5N6k.png)

## Step 3 -> Example Output

This screenshot shows the output as shown in Google Sheets

![Google Sheets Output](https://i.imgur.com/Dtg5AFc.png)

main.node: If review text is NOT empty
